externalDocs.description: See documentation for Akamai's IoT Token Access Control API

info.description:
Manage the public keys that authenticate JSON web token
requests for IoT devices.
info.title: Akamai: IoT Token Access Control API

post.description: Deploys the version of a key collection in the staging or production environment. Note that a key collection uses the public keys from its active version to validate JWTs in client requests. See [API concepts](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/api-concepts).

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's IoT Token Access Control API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

schema.description: Describes an activation request for a key collection version.

environment.description: The environment where you want to activate the version of the key collection, either `STAGING` or `PRODUCTION`.

keyCollectionVersionId.description: Identifies the key collection version to activate.

schema.description: Describes an activation of a key collection version, including the environment where you're activating this version and the status of the activation.

activatedBy.description: The username who sent the activation request.

environment.description: The environment where you're activating the key collection version, either `STAGING` or `PRODUCTION`.

keyCollectionVersionId.description: The identifier of the key collection version that you're activating.

keyCollectionVersionNo.description: The number of the version within the key collection. With each new version of this key collection, this number increments by 1.

startTime.description: An epoch timestamp when the activation started.

state.description: The status of the activation across the platform. These values are available: `PREPARED` when the system is ready to propagate the activation, `IN_PROGRESS` when the system is already propagating the activation, `DONE` when the system has successfully propagated the activation, `NOT_AVAILABLE` when the system has been unable to access data for the activation, or `ERROR` when the system has failed to propagate the activation. To fix the `ERROR` and `NOT_AVAILABLE` states, send another activation request. If it fails, contact support.

schema.description: Specifies an error response returned by the IoT Token Access Control API.

incidentId.description: A logging key useful when communicating about problems with Technical Support representatives.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.

type.description: Type of error.

schema.description: Specifies an error response returned by the IoT Token Access Control API.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to the problem.

details.description: A list of HTTP problem details. This field exists if there are many problems with a single request and you want to call them each out explicitly.

items.description: Specifies nested details of an error response.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to the problem. Consumers should not parse the `detail` member for information; extensions are more suitable and less error-prone ways to obtain such information.

incidentId.description: A logging key useful when communicating about problems with Technical Support representatives.

instance.description: A non-navigable URI that identifies each error instance.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.

type.description: A non-navigable URI that identifies each error case.

incidentId.description: A logging key useful when communicating about problems with Technical Support representatives.

instance.description: A non-navigable URI that identifies each error instance.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.

type.description: A non-navigable URI that identifies each error case.

403.description: [Forbidden](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/403). Not authorized to access the data that the request was made against.

get.description: Returns a list of activations for the key collection. If you don't already have the `collectionId`, run the [List key collections](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/get-key-collections) operation and use the appropriate `id` from the returned array.

post.description: Creates an empty key collection. To upload public keys to a newly created collection, run the [Create a key collection version](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/post-key-collection-version) operation. Also, store the `id` of the key collection for when you want to start referring to this collection in the JWT behavior of your property. See [API concepts](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/api-concepts).

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's IoT Token Access Control API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

schema.description: Provides information you need to provide when creating a key collection.

name.description: A descriptive label for the key collection.

schema.description: Describes a key collection, including versions that are active in the staging and production environments and the types of public keys they use to validate JWT signatures.

createdBy.description: The username who created the key collection.

createdDate.description: An epoch timestamp when the key collection was created.

id.description: The identifier of the key collection.

jwt.description: A string version of this key collection's `id` value.

name.description: A descriptive label for the key collection.

production.description: Describes the key collection version currently active in this environment.

algorithm.description: The encryption algorithm of the public keys that the version uses in this environment to validate JWT signatures, either `RSA` or `ECDSA_P_256`. To see the public keys that the version uses, run the [Get a key collection version](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/get-key-collection-version) operation.

id.description: The identifier of the key collection version.

no.description: The number of the key collection version.

startTime.description: An epoch timestamp when the key collection version was created.

staging.description: Describes the key collection version currently active in this environment.

algorithm.description: The encryption algorithm of the public keys that the version uses in this environment to validate JWT signatures, either `RSA` or `ECDSA_P_256`. To see the public keys that the version uses, run the [Get a key collection version](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/get-key-collection-version) operation.

id.description: The identifier of the key collection version.

no.description: The number of the key collection version.

startTime.description: An epoch timestamp when the key collection version was created.

get.description: Returns a list of key collections for the associated account. Also, for each returned collection, it specifies if any key collection versions are active in the staging and production environments.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's IoT Token Access Control API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

schema.description: Provides a list of key collections available within the account.

items.description: Describes a key collection, including versions that are active in the staging and production environments and the types of public keys they use to validate JWT signatures.

createdBy.description: The username who created the key collection.

createdDate.description: An epoch timestamp when the key collection was created.

id.description: The identifier of the key collection.

jwt.description: A string version of this key collection's `id` value.

name.description: A descriptive label for the key collection.

production.description: Describes the key collection version currently active in this environment.

algorithm.description: The encryption algorithm of the public keys that the version uses in this environment to validate JWT signatures, either `RSA` or `ECDSA_P_256`. To see the public keys that the version uses, run the [Get a key collection version](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/get-key-collection-version) operation.

id.description: The identifier of the key collection version.

no.description: The number of the key collection version.

startTime.description: An epoch timestamp when the key collection version was created.

staging.description: Describes the key collection version currently active in this environment.

algorithm.description: The encryption algorithm of the public keys that the version uses in this environment to validate JWT signatures, either `RSA` or `ECDSA_P_256`. To see the public keys that the version uses, run the [Get a key collection version](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/get-key-collection-version) operation.

id.description: The identifier of the key collection version.

no.description: The number of the key collection version.

startTime.description: An epoch timestamp when the key collection version was created.

get.description: Returns details about the key collection. It lists all created versions and specifies the ones active in the production and staging environments. If you don't already have the `collectionId`, run the [List key collections](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/get-key-collections) operation and use the appropriate `id` value from the returned array.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's IoT Token Access Control API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

schema.description: Describes a key collection, including all its versions as well as those active in the staging and production environments. It also shows the type of public keys these versions use to validate JWT signatures.

id.description: The identifier of the key collection.

name.description: A descriptive label for the key collection.

production.description: Describes the key collection version currently active in this environment.

algorithm.description: The encryption algorithm of the public keys that the version uses in this environment to validate JWT signatures, either `RSA` or `ECDSA_P_256`. To see the public keys that the version uses, run the [Get a key collection version](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/get-key-collection-version) operation.

id.description: The identifier of the key collection version.

no.description: The number of the key collection version.

startTime.description: An epoch timestamp when the key collection version was created.

staging.description: Describes the key collection version currently active in this environment.

algorithm.description: The encryption algorithm of the public keys that the version uses in this environment to validate JWT signatures, either `RSA` or `ECDSA_P_256`. To see the public keys that the version uses, run the [Get a key collection version](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/get-key-collection-version) operation.

id.description: The identifier of the key collection version.

no.description: The number of the key collection version.

startTime.description: An epoch timestamp when the key collection version was created.

versions.description: Information about key collection versions. Includes the type of public keys they use to validate JWT signatures, and whether they're active in the staging and production environments.

items.description: Describes a key collection version, including the type of public keys it uses to validate JWT signatures, and whether it's active in the staging and production environments.

algorithm.description: The encryption algorithm of the public keys that the key collection version uses, either `RSA` or `ECDSA_P_256`. To see the public keys that the version uses, run the [Get a key collection version](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/get-key-collection-version) operation.

collectionId.description: Identifies the key collection for this version.

createdBy.description: The username who created the key collection version.

createdDate.description: An epoch timestamp when the key collection version was created.

description.description: A description for the key collection version.

id.description: The identifier of the key collection version.

no.description: The number of the key collection version. With each new version of this key collection, this number increments by 1.

productionStatus.description: The status of the key collection version in the production environment, either `INACTIVE`, `PENDING`, or `ACTIVE`.

stagingStatus.description: The status of the key collection version in the staging environment, either `INACTIVE`, `PENDING`, or `ACTIVE`.

schema.description: Specifies an error response returned by the IoT Token Access Control API.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to the problem.

details.description: A list of HTTP problem details. This field exists if there are many problems with a single request and you want to call them each out explicitly.

items.description: Specifies nested details of an error response.

parameters.description: The identifier of the key collection.
parameters.name: collectionId

post.description: Creates a version of the key collection. Use it to provide primary and secondary public keys to verify JWTs passed in client requests. If you don't already have the `collectionId`, run the [List key collections](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/get-key-collections) operation and use the appropriate `id` value from the returned array. Also, to start using the public keys on staging or production, run the [Activate this key collection version](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/post-activation) operation.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's IoT Token Access Control API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

example.description: A key for IoT Edge Connect

schema.description: Contains information that you need to provide when creating a key collection version.

description.description: A descriptive label for the key collection version.

primaryKey.description: The primary public key that you want to use to validate JWT signatures. You can use an RSA key that's between 1024 and 4096 bits long, an ECDSA key that uses the P-256 (secp256k1) curve. Use a key in PEM format, which presents base64-encoded data between the begin header and the end footer. Make sure to use the same  encryption algorithm for the public keys in the `primaryKey` and `secondaryKey` members, either `RSA` or `ECDSA_P_256`. See [Keys and JWT signing algorithms](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/keys-and-jwt-signing-algorithms).

secondaryKey.description: The secondary public key that you want to use to validate JWT signatures in case `primaryKey` fails. You can use an RSA key that's between 1024 and 4096  bits long, an ECDSA key that uses the P-256 (secp256k1) curve. Use a key in PEM format, which presents base64-encoded data between the begin header and the end footer. Make sure to use the same encryption algorithm for the public keys in the `primaryKey` and `secondaryKey` members, either `RSA` or `ECDSA_P_256`. See [Key rotation](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/rotate-public-keys) and [Keys and JWT signing algorithms](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/keys-and-jwt-signing-algorithms).

example.description: A version active in the staging environment.

schema.description: Describes a key collection version, including the type of public keys it uses to validate JWT signatures, and whether it's active in the staging and production environments.

algorithm.description: The encryption algorithm of the public keys that the key collection version uses, either `RSA` or `ECDSA_P_256`. To see the public keys that the version uses, run the [Get a key collection version](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/get-key-collection-version) operation.

collectionId.description: Identifies the key collection for this version.

createdBy.description: The username who created the key collection version.

createdDate.description: An epoch timestamp when the key collection version was created.

description.description: A description for the key collection version.

id.description: The identifier of the key collection version.

no.description: The number of the key collection version. With each new version of this key collection, this number increments by 1.

productionStatus.description: The status of the key collection version in the production environment, either `INACTIVE`, `PENDING`, or `ACTIVE`.

stagingStatus.description: The status of the key collection version in the staging environment, either `INACTIVE`, `PENDING`, or `ACTIVE`.

415.description: [Unsupported Media Type](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/415). Use the valid content type request body.

parameters.description: The identifier of the key collection.
parameters.name: collectionId

get.description: Returns details about the key collection version. It returns the public keys the version uses to verify JWTs and reports on whether they're are active in the production and staging environments.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's IoT Token Access Control API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

example.description: The first version of the collection with a primary key for Edge Connect.

schema.description: Describes a key collection version, including its public keys and details about the encryption algorithm used for their generation. It also specifies whether the version is active in the staging and production environments.

algorithm.description: The encryption algorithm of the public keys in the `primaryKey` and `secondaryKey` members, either `RSA` or `ECDSA_P_256`.

algorithmDetails.description: Details about the encryption algorithm used to generate the public  key in the `primaryKey` member. For `RSA`, it specifies the length of an RSA   key. For `ECDSA_P_256`, it specifies the parameter of the P-256 elliptic curve, only `secp256k1` is available at this time. See [Keys and JWT signing algorithms](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/keys-and-jwt-signing-algorithms).

collectionId.description: The identifier of the key collection.

description.description: A description for the key collection version.

primaryKey.description: The primary RSA or ECDSA public key. The version uses it to validate JWT signatures. This key is in PEM format, which presents base64-encoded data between the begin header and the end footer. See [Keys and JWT signing algorithms](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/keys-and-jwt-signing-algorithms).

production.description: Contains detailed information about the status of the key collection version in this environment.

activatedBy.description: The username who activated the key collection version.

activatedOn.description: An epoch timestamp when the activation started.

status.description: The status of the key collection version in the environment. These values are available: `INACTIVE`, `PENDING`, or `ACTIVE`.

secondaryAlgorithmDetails.description: Details about the encryption algorithm used to generate the public  key in the `secondaryKey` member. For `RSA`, it specifies the length of the  RSA key. For `ECDSA_P_256`, it specifies the parameter of the P-256 elliptic curve, only `secp256k1` is available at this time. See [Keys and JWT signing algorithms](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/keys-and-jwt-signing-algorithms).

secondaryKey.description: The backup RSA or ECDSA public key. The version uses it to validate JWT signatures in case the `primaryKey` fails. This key is in PEM format, which presents base64-encoded data between the begin header and the end footer. See [Key rotation](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/rotate-public-keys) and [Keys and JWT signing algorithms](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-token-access-control/reference/keys-and-jwt-signing-algorithms).

staging.description: Contains detailed information about the status of the key collection version in this environment.

activatedBy.description: The username who activated the key collection version.

activatedOn.description: An epoch timestamp when the activation started.

status.description: The status of the key collection version in the environment. These values are available: `INACTIVE`, `PENDING`, or `ACTIVE`.

versionId.description: The identifier of the key collection version.

versionNo.description: The number of the key collection version. With each new version of this key collection, this number increments by 1.
